articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Syrian Economic Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Syrian Economic Delegation
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly conversation with the Syrian government economic delegation led by Minister of Economy and Commerce Amer Hosni Lutfi at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him. 
					The head of the delegation expressed belief that the plan of General Secretary Kim Jong Il for building a thriving nation would be successfully realized, reiterating the will to make positive efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between Syria and the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift from Syrian Economy Minister
articles.content:
Gift from Syrian Economy Minister
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Minister of Economy and Commerce of Syria Amer Hosni Lutfi on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by the minister Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK Order Awarded to Syrian Economy Minister
articles.content:
DPRK Order Awarded to Syrian Economy Minister
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Order of DPRK Friendship 1st Class was awarded to Amer Hosni Lutfi, minister of Economy and Commerce of Syria, in recognition of his positive contribution to developing friendship and economic cooperation between the DPRK and Syria.
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, the DPRK ambassador to Syria, officials concerned, members of the Syrian government economic delegation and the charge d' affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here.

articles.title: DPRK-Syria Joint Economic Committee Meets
articles.content:
DPRK-Syria Joint Economic Committee Meets
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The 6th meeting of the DPRK-Syria Joint Economic Committee took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on October 27 and 28.
					 Present there were members of the DPRK government economic delegation led by Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, and members of the Syrian government economic delegation led by Minister of Economy and Commerce Amer Hosni Lutfi and Charge d' affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here Souheil Haidar. 
					
					 The implementation of the protocol on the 5th meeting of the joint committee was reviewed and a protocol on the 6th meeting of the joint committee on economic and trade and scientific and technological cooperation was signed at the meeting.

articles.title: Agreements and MOU Signed between DPRK and Syria
articles.content:
Agreements and MOU Signed between DPRK and Syria
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation in tourism between the governments of the DPRK and Syria, an agreement on cooperation in public health and medical science between the ministries of public health of the two countries, an agreement on cooperation in science and technology between the State Administration for Quality Management of the DPRK and the Syrian Organization for Standardization and Metrology and a MOU on cooperation and exchange in agriculture between the DPRK Ministry of Agriculture and the Syrian Ministry of Agriculture and Agrarian Reform were signed with due ceremony at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik, Director of the State General Bureau of Tourism Kim To Jun, DPRK Ambassador to Syria Choe Su Hon and officials concerned and from the Syrian side members of the Syrian government economic delegation led by Minister of Economy and Commerce Amer Hosni Lutfi and Charge d' affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here Souheil Haidar.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Turkish President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Turkish President
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Abdulah Gul, President of Turkey, on the occasion of its national holiday.
					 Kim in the message wished the president and the people of Turkey successes in their work for development and prosperity of the country and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Feted by C.C., CPC
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Feted by C.C., CPC
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China arranged a reception at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Oct. 27 in honor of the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the WPK delegation and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Present there were Liu Yunshan, member of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China who is member of its Political Bureau, and Liu Hongcai, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Czech Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Czech Ambassador Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Czech Ambassador to the DPRK Martin Tomco gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Tuesday on the occasion of the national day of the Czech Republic.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of various countries and staff members of missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Officials of the embassy of the Czech Republic were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: German Embassies Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
German Embassies Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the German embassy here did friendship work at the DPRK-Germany Friendship Sunan Farm, Sunan District of Pyongyang Wednesday.
					 They helped farmers in putting manure around fruit trees.
					
					 The guests handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Wrestling Gold Medalists
articles.content:
Wrestling Gold Medalists
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has recently produced one more world wrestling champion.
					 It is Yang Kyong Il who bagged a gold medal at the 55kg category freestyle event in the 2009 World Wrestling Championship.
					
					 The wrestling of the DPRK has covered the road of rapid development from the 1980s. The wrestlers have registered world startling successes in the international contests, fluttering high the national flag of the Republic.
					
					 Kim Chol Hwan became a two-time world champion by winning the 22nd and 23rd world freestyle wrestling championships.
					
					 Among the two-time world championship holders are Kim Yong Sik and Ri Jae Sik.
					
					 The wrestling stars include Kim Il who won two Olympic gold medals and Ri Hak Son who placed first in the 52kg category freestyle contest in the 25th Olympiad.
					
					 All of them are loved by the Korean people for having enhanced the national glory with gold medals.

articles.title: "White Satsuma" Made by Koreans
articles.content:
"White Satsuma" Made by Koreans
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The white porcelain "White Satsuma" treasured by the Japanese is permeated with blood, sweat and efforts of Koreans.
					 The porcelain was very popular among the Japanese ceramics in the period from the 17th century to the 19th century for its highest quality. It caught the attention of the visitors in "International Fairs" held in France and Austria in the 19th century and was exported even to Europe to win popularity.
					
					 The "White Satsuma" imitating the white porcelain of Ri Dynasty was made by Pak Phyong Ui, a famous Korean ceramist.
					
					 It was described in the short true story "I cannot forget my hometown" (transcribed from Korean) written by Ryotaro Shiba, a famous historical novelist of Japan.
					
					 The story was based on the itinerary of Nangei Tachibana, a noted medical doctor and scholar of Japan in the middle ages.
					
					 Pak Phyong Ui was one of the ceramists kidnapped in the Namwon Castle (then) in Jolla Province by gangsters of Yoshihiro Shimazu, lord of Satsuma (present Kagoshima Prefecture in southwest Kyushu), during the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598) against Japanese invaders.
					
					 Yoshihiro Shimazu forced the kidnapped 70-odd Korean ceramic craftsmen to survey of clay, the raw material of ceramics. Pak Phyong Ui and his son Pak Jong Yong, who were versed in ceramic technique, discovered the white clay essential to ceramic production and made the "White Satsuma".
					
					 The Korean ceramists taken to Japan built kilns in remote places and were forced to manufacture porcelain for scores of years or generation after generation under humiliation and insult. Hundreds of kiln sites came into being throughout Japan at that time and later turned into hubs of porcelain production in Japan.
					
					 In Satsuma alone a street consisted of dwelling houses of Koreans and there existed 17 surnames. Therefore, people in Satsuma called the street Koma Street (Koryo Street). Though hundreds of years have passed since then, the song for the memorial service is sung and technical terms used at the kiln sites are still spoken in Korean.
					
					 "Arita-yaki", "hagi-yaki", "agano-yaki" and other ceramics famous in Japan were also manufactured by the Korean porcelain artisans kidnapped to Japan during the war.
					
					 The porcelain culture of Japan is the one entirely based on stealing and kidnapping unprecedented in history.

articles.title: Disclosed Japan-U.S. Collusion for Nuclear Attack on DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
Disclosed Japan-U.S. Collusion for Nuclear Attack on DPRK under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Recently Reuters reported about the information declassified at the national archives of George Washington University that the United States and Japan reached an agreement on allowing U.S.-made nuclear weapons into Japanese territory when U.S.-Japan Security Treaty was revised in 1960.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 This clearly testifies to the fact that there was a secret agreement on the use and transport of nuclear weapons between the U.S. and the government of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan besides the document made known to the public.
					
					 It is not the first time that the above-said secret agreement between Japan and the U.S. on the introduction of nuclear weapons to Japan was disclosed, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Japan made desperate efforts to slander and do harm to others while pretending to be upright and honest as far as the nuclear issue is concerned. But this time it was brought to light that this country was busy colluding with the U.S. in its strategy for nuclear assault on the DPRK after discarding such international commitment as the "three non-nuclear principles" behind the scene. How shameful and cynical it is.
					
					 There is practically no other country that can match Japan in running the whole gamut of wrongdoings such as deceiving others to draw water to its mill and blaming others.
					
					 It is Japan that adamantly refuses to settle its crime-woven past though the world is so strongly demanding it do so and it is again Japan that is rushing headlong into nuclear weaponization under the pretext of "denuclearization". 
					
					 The LDP of Japan should be held accountable for making the country suffer so bitter disgrace before the international community and rendering the regional situation so disturbing.

articles.title: Actions for Frustrating U.S. "Human Rights" Offensive Called for
articles.content:
Actions for Frustrating U.S. "Human Rights" Offensive Called for
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The imperialists are taking issue with the so-called "human rights performance" in other countries while shelving their own hideous human rights abuses. Lurking behind this is a sinister intention to put other countries and nations under their domination under the pretext of "human rights issue." 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The imperialists leave no means untried to realize their ambition for world domination by employing craftier and more desperate methods now that their dominating position is rapidly sinking and the strong-arm policy, a leftover of the outdated era, no longer works.
					
					The "human rights" offensive is one of those methods.
					
					 The imperialists are taking issue with the so-called "human rights situations" in other countries in a bid to attain their sinister aims, while behaving as if they were a "world human rights judge" which no country of the world recognizes.
					
					 They are intensifying the "human rights" offensive against other countries for the purpose of realizing their ambition for world domination. This offensive is mainly targeted against those countries regarded as their potential rivals and countries strong in their anti-imperialist independent stand. They cook up "human rights abuses" in those countries and internationalize them in a bid to effectively use them for attaining their hegemonic purpose.
					
					 The U.S. talks a lot about "human rights issues" of other countries not knowing where it stands. This is nothing but an artifice to obstruct the independent development of those countries and achieve its hegemonic objective.
					
					 If the imperialists are truly interested in the human rights issue, they should respect the sovereignty of other countries and stop interfering in their internal affairs.
					
					 Those who aspire after independence against imperialism and genuine human rights should further intensify the struggle to check and frustrate the reactionary "human rights" offensive of the imperialists.

articles.title: Subordinating Everything to Interests of Nation Called for
articles.content:
Subordinating Everything to Interests of Nation Called for
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- It is an urgent need of the times for the north and the south to get reconciled and unite for the common cause of the nation, putting aside the differing ideologies and systems.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 If the inter-Korean relations are to improve it is necessary to put the common interests of the nation that are national reunification above anything else and achieve reconciliation and unity on this basis.
					
					 Differing ideologies and systems exist in the north and the south, but they can never be obstacles to national reconciliation and unity. No matter how strikingly the north and the south may differ from each other in ideologies and systems, these differences can hardly be big enough to hurt the common interests of the nation. It is possible to protect the dignity and interests of each member of the nation only when the common interests of the nation are defended as there can be no classes and strata apart from the nation.
					
					 "By our nation itself", the idea of national independence and unity, serves as mental power making it possible for the north and the south to pool efforts for promoting co-existence, co-prosperity and common interests and achieving the cause of national reunification irrespective of differing ideologies and systems.
					
					 If the differing ideologies and systems are regarded absolute, utterly indifferent to the interests of the nation, it is quite impossible to improve the inter-Korean relations nor is it possible to achieve concord and unity of the nation.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to treat and join hands with anyone who is willing to contribute to the cause of national reunification, setting store by the national interests with national conscience, on the principle of not digging into his or her past.
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south and overseas will wage a more dynamic patriotic struggle to achieve national reunification holding aloft the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and will never allow any act to hamstring the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve national reunification.

articles.title: Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Observed
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Observed
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- An Asia-Pacific regional preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Pakistan on Oct. 17 and a Slovak preparatory committee for commemorating the anniversary was formed in Bratislava on Oct. 20.
					At the inaugurating ceremony, Madav Kumar Nepal, prime minister of Nepal, was elected honorary chairman of the Asia-Pacific regional preparatory committee. The preparatory committee is co-chaired by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister of Cambodia in charge of the Royal Palace, Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, minister of Mass Communication and Promotion of Investment of Sri Lanka who doubles as chairman of the Sri Lanka-People's Korea Friendship Association, Mian Raja Labani, deputy secretary general of the Pakistan People's Party and senator of the Pakistani parliament, P. Shiv Shankar, chairman of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, and the chairperson of the National Guidance Council of the Vanguard Party of Indonesia. The chairman of the Slovak Association for Supporting the Juche Idea was elected chairman of the Slovak preparatory committee.
					
					The inaugurating ceremony of the Asia-Pacific regional preparatory committee adopted an appeal to national and regional preparatory committees for commemorating the centenary of birth of
						 Kim Il Sung.
					
					The appeal called for actively staging various activities for lauding the immortal life and exploits of
						 Kim Il Sung. It underscored the need to form an international preparatory committee for the purpose of coordinating and assisting, if necessary, the activities of the preparatory committees for commemorating the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung organized in different countries and regions and thus conduct a positive work for significantly commemorating the Day of the Sun in 2012 worldwide. 
					
					It called for taking an active part in various functions including "International Joint Meeting for Commemorating the Centenary of Kim Il Sungâ€™s Korea" to be held in the DPRK in 2012 to make a tangible contribution to the efforts to ensure that the history of the President remains shining forever. 
					
					The Slovak committee decided to hold various political and cultural events such as round-table talks and lectures till the Day of the Sun in 2012 with a view to widely introducing the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung and the reality of the DPRK wining one victory after another under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Valuable Sheets of Paper
articles.content:
Valuable Sheets of Paper
 Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- It was in September Juche 36 (1947) when the anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk stayed in Kyongsong County.
					 One day three rural women residing in a nearby village came to see her who had earned fame on the battlefield against Japanese imperialism, carrying some early pears with them.
					
					 While having conversation with them, she noticed that they were all illiterate. She said to the following effect: An illiterate is not different from a blind fool. An unlettered person can neither arm himself with the idea of General Kim Il Sung nor contribute to the building of a new country. You should not feel shame at illiteracy but assiduously study at an adults' school from now on.
					
					 She took out three sheets of paper and wrote something on them. She gave them one sheet apiece, saying that it was her address and they should write a letter to her after learning how to read and write.
					
					 They were moved to tears with the valuable sheets of paper in their bosom.

articles.title: Celebrada 6a reunion de comision economica mixta Corea-Siria
articles.content:
Celebrada 6a reunion de comision economica mixta Corea-Siria
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar los dias 27 y 28 la sexta reunion de la comision economica mixta Corea-Siria en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae.
					En la ocasion participaron los miembros de la delegacion economica gubernamental de Corea encabezada por el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, los integrantes de la delegacion homologa de Siria presidida por el ministro de Economia y Comercio Amer Hosni Lutfi y el encargado de negocios a.i. sirio en Corea Souheil Haidar.
					
					Ambas partes balancearon la ejecucion del protocolo alcanzado en la anterior reunion de la comision y firmaron el otro sobre la cooperacion economico-comercial y cientifico-tecnica de la presente cita.

articles.title: Firmados en Pyongyang documentos entre Corea y Siria
articles.content:
Firmados en Pyongyang documentos entre Corea y Siria
 Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedaron firmados el dia 28 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae una serie de documentos entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Arabe de Siria.
					Especificamente, fueron suscritos el convenio sobre la cooperacion en el turismo entre los gobiernos de la RPDC y de la RAS, el otro sobre la cooperacion en la salud publica y la medicina entre los Ministerios de Salud Publica de los dos paises, el otro sobre la cooperacion cientifico-tecnologica entre la Direccion Estatal de Verificacion de la Calidad de Productos de Corea y la Direccion General para Estandarizacion y Medida de Siria y la nota de entendimiento sobre la cooperacion e intercambio en la rama de agricultura entre el Ministerio de Agricultura de Corea y el Ministerio de Agricultura y Reforma Agraria de Siria.
					
					 En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el ministro de Salud Publica Choe Chang Sik, el director general de la Direccion Nacional de Turismo Kim To Jun, el embajador coreano en Siria Choe Su Hon y otros funcionarios coreanos y por la siriaca, los miembros de la delegacion economica gubernamental de Siria encabezada por el ministro de Economia y Comercio Amer Hosni Lutfi y el encargado de negocios a.i Souheil Haidar en Corea.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena confabulacion EE.UU- Japon en area nuclear
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena confabulacion EE.UU- Japon en area nuclear
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ATCC) -- Segun el reciente reporte de Reuters, en el archivo nacional de la Universidad George Washington se dio a la publicidad un dato revelando que Estados Unidos y Japon acordaron el problema del paso de las armas nucleares de fabricacion norteamericana por el territorio japones al renovar en 1960 el tratado de seguridad bilateral.
					 Esto testimonia claramente que entre EE.UU. y el regimen del Partido Democratico Liberal de Japon hubo un acuerdo secreto relativo al uso y al transporte de las armas nucleares, aparte del documento oficializado.
					
					 Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 28 y continua:
					
					 Esta no es la primera vez que se revelara la existencia de cierto acuerdo entre Japon y EE.UU. sobre la introduccion de esos artefactos de exterminio masivo en el primer pais.
					
					 En el pasado, Japon actuaba desesperadamente para censurar y calumniar a otros paises fingiendo ser honesto en cuanto al problema nuclear.
					
					 Pero, el hecho arriba mencionado revela a todo el mundo que Japon se confabulo con EE.UU. en la estrategia de ataque nuclear de este contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea abandonando los "tres principios para la desnuclearizacion", a que se ha comprometido en la arena internacional.
					
					 Japon es el campeon en las maldades como enganar y acusar injustamente a otros para sacar sus provechos.
					
					 Es precisamente ese pais isleno el que rehusa obstinadamente liquidar su pasado de crimenes desoyendo tal persistente demanda de todo el mundo y viene acelerando el armamentismo nuclear detras del cartel de "desnuclearizacion".
					
					 El Partido Democratico Liberal de Japon debe asumir la responsabilidad por haber deshonrado a su pais ante la sociedad internacional y complicado la situacion regional.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun aboga por interes comun de la nacion,
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun aboga por interes comun de la nacion,
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Norte y el Sur de Corea se reconcilian y se unen para la causa comun de la nacion por encima de las diferencias de las ideologias y regimenes, lo cual es la demanda apremiante de la epoca.
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					Para mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas, hay que anteponer el interes comun de la nacion que es la reunificacion de la patria y lograr a base de eso la reconciliacion y la unidad.
					
					Aunque existen en el Norte y el Sur las diferentes ideologias y regimenes, lo cual no puede ser jamas obstaculo de la reconciliacion y la unidad nacionales.  Por mas grandes que sean esas diferencias Norte-Sur, no podran ser mas grandes que el interes comun de la nacion.
					
					Puesto que no pueden existir las clases y capas al margen de la nacion, solo al defender los intereses comunes de la nacion es posible mantener tambien la dignidad e interes de cada integrante de la nacion.
					
					El ideal de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales", ideal de la independencia y la unidad nacionales es la fuerza espiritual que permite al Norte y el Sur  unir las fuerzas para promover la coexistencia, la coprosperidad  e interes  comun y lograr la causa de la reunificacion de la patria por encima de las diferencias de ideologias y regimenes.
					
					Si absolutizan solo tales diferencias sin tomar en consideracion el interes de la nacion, es imposible mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas y realizar la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion.
					
					Los que quieren hacer aporte a la causa de la reunificacion de la patria apreciando el interes de la nacion con la conciencia nacional deben tratarlos en el principio de no preguntarles su pasado y tomar las manos con ellos. Esto es la invariable posicion de la RPDC.
					
					Todos los coreanos del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar desplegaran con mas vigor la lucha patriotica por lograr la reunificacion de la patria con la bandera de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre en alto y no perdonaran ningunas acciones que impiden el mejoramiento de las relaciones intercoreanas y la reunificacion de la patria.
